<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="partnerships">Partnerships<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#partnerships" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Partnerships between services are critical to the success of working in health promoting ways; the importance of this is recognized by practitioners across all levels. Successful partnerships strengthen the capacity of projects and services to broaden their reach, engage more stakeholders and achieve shared objectives.</p>
<p>Working in partnership may be beneficial at an organizational and an individual level. Partnerships may be either strategic and concerned with the broad program concept, scope, and direction or planning; or operational and concerned with resources, incentives, engagement and communication.</p>
<p>A partnership is usually a voluntary agreement but it may also include formal written agreements and contracts between two or more partners.</p>
<p>Partnerships can achieve greater outcomes than individuals or organizations acting alone. Partnerships achieve increased benefits because they share expertise, skills and resources. These benefits can include:</p>
<ul>
<li>more effective service delivery</li>
<li>more efficient resourcing</li>
<li>policy development at organizational or community levels</li>
<li>systems development as a result of changed relations between organizations</li>
<li>Social and community development aimed at strengthening community action.</li>
</ul>
<p>To achieve their potential, partnerships should be transparent and accountable, and be based on agreed ethical principles, mutual understanding, commitment and respect for the capacity of all partners. Where the capacity of each partner is different, these principles need to be clearly understood. In short-term partnerships these principles may not be as apparent as they might be in longer-term or more involved partnerships.</p>
<p>Some partnerships may need formal agreements, such as a contract or a memorandum of understanding. Others may only need simple records of commitments and agreements made. It is essential to identify the most appropriate documentation to support the partnership early. Partnerships can operate at different levels - this is determined by how much resources and information are shared, and the willingness to change activities and increase capacity for a common purpose, or for mutual benefit.</p>
<p>The public, private and community sectors need to explore opportunities to collaborate on health promotion. There are many ways they can work together on this, including networks and coordinated, cooperative and collaborative partnerships.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="unit-4-human-resource-management">UNIT 4: HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#unit-4-human-resource-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="4-1-key-concepts-and-principles-of-human-resource-management-what-is-human-resource-management-hrm">4.1. Key concepts and principles of human resource management What is Human Resource Management (HRM)?<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#4-1-key-concepts-and-principles-of-human-resource-management-what-is-human-resource-management-hrm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>HRM is a specialty within the broader field of management that focuses on managing employees. HRM is the process of attraction, acquisition, development, motivation and maintenance of labour at optimum levels most efficiently and effectively. In addition, HRM is a model of personnel management that focuses on the individual rather than taking a collective approach. Responsibility for human resource management is often devolved to line management. It is characterized by an emphasis on strategic integration, employee commitment, workforce flexibility, and quality of goods and services</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="purpose-of-hrm">Purpose of HRM<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#purpose-of-hrm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The primary purpose of personnel management is to contribute to the profitability and survival of an organization by effective management of its</p>
<p>total human resources. The success of any organization depends on productive and effective people. An effective HRM will directly contribute to organizational efficiency and minimizes high rates of turnover and unresolved conflicts between staff members. Poorly managed staff can be very costly to an organization both in terms of productivity and finances. HRM is therefore important to all managers because they require an effective HRM as they are charged with the management of the human resource aspect within an organization.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="practices-in-human-resource-management-notes-needed-here">Practices in human resource management Notes needed here<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#practices-in-human-resource-management-notes-needed-here" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="typical-hrm-functions-practices-and-activities">Typical HRM functions (Practices and Activities)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#typical-hrm-functions-practices-and-activities" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>In summary the typical HRM functions are as follows:</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="1-staffing">1. Staffing<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-staffing" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is about hiring the right people with the right skills at the right time and more important is that the process must comply with Human Rights Legislation. The activities in staffing include:</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="i-job-analysis">i) Job analysis<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#i-job-analysis" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is a process for systematically collecting information to help you fully understand and describe the duties and responsibilities of a position as well as the Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSA) required in doing the job. The purpose is to provide information.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="ii-job-description">ii) Job description<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ii-job-description" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is the statement that gives the purpose, scope, responsibilities and tasks, which make up a stated job. Job descriptions are used on the basis of most other human resource management practices such as selection, training and performance management.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="iii-recruitment">iii) Recruitment<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iii-recruitment" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Recruitment is the process of finding and employing individuals to carry out the tasks that need to be done within the organization. It is the term given to the overall activity of choosing suitable applications for job vacancies and selection is included.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="iv-induction-of-new-staff">iv) Induction of new staff<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iv-induction-of-new-staff" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Orientation of all new staff is done by the HRM department. They take the new staff through all the company's policies and processes, and ensure that the new staffs understand what is expected of them.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-training-and-development">2. Training and development<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-training-and-development" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Training is a planned process to modify attitude, knowledge and skill behaviour through learning experience to achieve effective performance in an activity or range of activities.
Development is a strategic approach to investment in the skill, expertise and capabilities of an organizations employee (its human capital). It provides a framework for self-development, and career progression to meet an organization's future skill requirements. This includes: induction, socialization of the employees to fit the cultural requirements of the organization, career</p>
<p>plans etc. Good organizations are those who value learning or training and development for their staff.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="3-compensation-and-benefits">3. Compensation and benefits<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-compensation-and-benefits" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Some of the compensation and benefits organizations give their employees include:
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Compensation plans incase of accidents and medical bills
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Benefits that an employee will enjoy within the organization
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Retirement plans e.g. pension</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="4-people-management">4. People management<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#4-people-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This includes:
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Work plans and establishing adequate communication systems
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Recognition and team motivation
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Conflict resolution,
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Grievances and Discipline,
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Staff performance appraisal
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Termination and;
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Counseling.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="5-work-place-management">5. Work place management<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-work-place-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This includes:
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Work life balance,
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Implementation of the organizations safety policy (Health and safety)
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Diversity to avoid monotony (e.g. job rotation, enrichment and enlargement)
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> In summary, HRM in the current times has a more pragmatic, proactive, flexible and prescriptive approach. The strategic focus of HRM now is the development of new ideas to make the human being a happier productive worker in order to forge a partnership between him/her and the management. By having a supportive HRM framework, an organization will have:
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Staff with the knowledge and skills needed to achieve organizational goals,
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> Staff who understand what is expected of them and how their work contributes to the mission and vision of the organization, and ;
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>&gt;</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">&gt;</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5782em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span></span></span></span></span> A work environment which brings out the best in the employees, and that is safe and healthy.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="human-resource-recruitment">Human Resource Recruitment<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#human-resource-recruitment" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is the process of finding and attracting candidates who qualifies to fill job vacancies. Job recruits can be drawn from within or outside the organization. However, before recruiting can take place, a job analysis consisting of a position description and job specification must be made.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="performance-management">Performance Management<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#performance-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This includes:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Work plans and establishing adequate communication systems</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Recognition and team motivation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Conflict resolution,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Grievances and Discipline,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Staff performance appraisal</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Termination and;</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Counseling.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="human-resource-development">Human Resource Development<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#human-resource-development" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Is a strategic approach to investment in the skill, expertise and capabilities of an organizations employee (its human capital). It provides a framework for self-development, and career progression to meet an organization's future skill requirements. This includes: induction, socialization of the employees to fit the cultural requirements of the organization, career plans etc. Good organizations are those who value learning or training and development for their staff.
This is the statement that gives the purpose, scope, responsibilities and tasks, which make up a stated job. Job descriptions are used on the basis of most other human resource management practices such as selection, training and performance management.
This is a process for systematically collecting information to help you fully understand and describe the duties and responsibilities of a position as well as the Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSA) required in doing the job. The purpose</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="4-2-professionalism-and-work-ethics-in-the-health-care-system-and-medico-legal-issues">4.2. Professionalism and work ethics in the health care system and medico - legal issues<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#4-2-professionalism-and-work-ethics-in-the-health-care-system-and-medico-legal-issues" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="unit-5-commodity-and-supplies-management">UNIT 5: COMMODITY AND SUPPLIES MANAGEMENT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#unit-5-commodity-and-supplies-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="5-1-the-commodity-management-cycle">5.1. The commodity management cycle<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-1-the-commodity-management-cycle" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>What is a Commodity?
A commodity is something that is fixed in the sense that it is basically the same, no matter who supplies it. Common commodities that we are all familiar with include petrol, gas, wheat, coffee (to a large extent), gold and of course, oil, but in effect there are many more
Commodity management is becoming an increasingly important role within the supply chain community as more and more companies attempt to secure their supplier lines, deliver value for money and develop structured relationships with key suppliers. Although a commodity manager has a clear managerial role within the process, it is the context that the manager operates in as a whole that is significant</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="what-is-supply-management">What is Supply Management?<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#what-is-supply-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>A broad term describing the various acts of identifying, acquiring and managing the products and resources to meet a pre-determined need in an organization. These include physical goods, information, services and any other resources. Supply management comprises up to <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>75</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">75 \%</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8056em; vertical-align: -0.0556em;"></span><span class="mord">75%</span></span></span></span></span> to <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>85</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">85 \%</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8056em; vertical-align: -0.0556em;"></span><span class="mord">85%</span></span></span></span></span> of an organization's expenditure.
The main goals within supply management are to control costs, efficiently allocate resources and gather information to be used in strategic organizational decisions.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="commodity-management-cycle">Commodity Management Cycle<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#commodity-management-cycle" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Supply chain management
Supply chain management (SCM) is the management of a network of interconnected businesses involved in the ultimate provision of goods, works and service packages required by end customers Supply chain management spans all movement and storage of raw materials, work-in-process inventory, and finished goods from point of origin to point of consumption (supply chain).</p>
<p>The main components of supply management are:
Procurement
Stores administration and control (including warehousing)
Distribution and logistics
Sourcing
Sourcing is the identification and evaluation of potential suppliers
Selection of appropriate /suitable suppliers and sources of supply
Managing the relationship with the suppliers
Sources of supply
Internally generated and manually maintained supplier databases
Contract history i.e. past performance</p>
<p>Internet
Client preferences
Supplier agreements. These are used with known future requirements (e.g. vehicles)
Vendor-base reduction
Suppliers partnerships
Prequalification of bidders
Trade directories
Media
Exhibitions and trade fairs</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="5-2-procurement-procedure">5.2. Procurement procedure<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-2-procurement-procedure" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Procurement is one of the key functions within the supply chain. Procurement is the acquisition of goods, works and/or services. It is favorable that the goods, works and services are appropriate and that they are procured at the best possible cost to meet the needs of the purchaser in terms of quality and quantity, time, and location. The five rights of procurement are:</p>
<ul>
<li>Buy the right item/goods,</li>
<li>At the right price</li>
<li>Buy the right quality</li>
<li>The right quantity</li>
<li>Delivered to the right place</li>
</ul>
<p>Before starting any procurement there must be provisioning. This is where an organization identifies a need and allocates resources to meet the identified need. It includes the drawing of a procurement plan. Every department in a procuring entity is required to make a work plan showing the activities they intend to undertake, resources needed and proposed budgets. These are then consolidated in a procurement plan for the entire procuring entity by the procurement department and approved by the head of the procuring entity who is usually the accounting Officer.</p>
<p>A procuring Entity will only initiate a procurement process after confirming that funds are available to meet the expenditure. A procurement method is then selected depending on the type of goods or services to be procured and their estimated values. The GOK allows the following procurement methods.</p>
<ol>
<li>Open Tender including International Bidding</li>
<li>Restricted Tendering</li>
<li>Request for Proposals</li>
<li>Direct procurement</li>
<li>Request for Quotations</li>
<li>Low Value Procurement</li>
<li>Specially permitted Procurement i.e. framework contracts, design competition-procurement, public private partnerships(concessions)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="open-tender">Open Tender:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#open-tender" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Applies both to local and international bidders and is the preferred method of procurement. It is open to all tenderer's who feel competent to purchase the tender documents. The procedure is as follows:</p>
<ol>
<li>Tender advertisement notice (in a media of wide circulation)</li>
<li>Tender preparation and submission within 28 days for local and 42 days for international</li>
<li>Tender opening</li>
<li>Tender Evaluation and adjudication</li>
<li>Tender award and notification to bidders (within bid validity period of 90 days for local 150 days for international)</li>
<li>Signing of contract</li>
<li>Contract implementation</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="restricted-tender">Restricted Tender:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#restricted-tender" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>This is only used in the acquisition of complex or specialized goods, services or works. It can also be used where the time and cost to evaluate a large number of tenders would be disproportionate to the value of goods, works or services. The procedure is as follows</p>
<ol>
<li>Prequalification of tender advertisement notice</li>
<li>Bid invitation to pre-qualified candidates</li>
<li>Tender preparation and submission (same as open tender)</li>
<li>Tender opening</li>
<li>Tender Evaluation and adjudication</li>
<li>Tender award and notification to bidders (within bid validity period of 90 days for local 150 days for international)</li>
<li>Signing of contract</li>
<li>Contract implementation</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="request-for-quotations">Request for Quotations<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#request-for-quotations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is another method of procurement commonly used where the procurement is of goods readily available and for which there is an established market; and the estimated value of goods being procured is less than or equal to the prescribed maximum value for using RFQ. The threshold for this is between Ksh. 500,000 to Ksh. 1,000,000 depending on the class of the procuring entity. The procedure is as follows:
Potential bidders are picked from the list of pre-qualified suppliers where this is mandatory or from known suppliers in the market or a list of approved suppliers from previous relationships. Depending on the size of the contract, 3-7 bidders are invited to compete for the business.</p>
<ol>
<li>A quotation committee or tender committee is convened</li>
<li>Quotation opening is done</li>
<li>Quotation Evaluation and adjudication</li>
<li>Contract award and notification to bidders</li>
<li>Signing of contract</li>
<li>Contract implementation</li>
</ol>
<p>Validity period of a quotation is 90 days</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="direct-procurement">Direct Procurement:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#direct-procurement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>This method may only be used where only very rare goods are needed or only one candidate can supply the goods, services or works. There is no reasonable alternative or substitute for the goods, works or services; it can be used in times of national emergency and disaster. The circumstances that gave rise to the urgency are not foreseeable. It must not be used with a view to discriminate or avoid possible competition. Its threshold is Ksh. 300,000. The procedure is as follows</p>
<ol>
<li>Prepare need description</li>
<li>Describe special requirements as to quality, quantity, terms and times of delivery, price etc</li>
<li>Negotiation with sole candidate</li>
<li>Procurement agreement confirmed by signed contract</li>
<li>If below threshold Local Purchase Order/Local Service Order is issued</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="low-value-procurement">Low Value Procurement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#low-value-procurement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This method is used if</p>
<ul>
<li>The estimated value of the goods, works or services being procured are less than or equal to the prescribed maximum value for this procedure</li>
<li>No benefit accrues to the PE in terms of time or costs if it uses this procedure</li>
<li>The procedure is not being used to avoid competition</li>
<li>The procedure has been recommended by the procurement committee after a market survey.</li>
<li>This is cash purchase.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="request-for-proposals">Request for Proposals:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#request-for-proposals" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This method is used to obtain consulting services or combinations of goods and service for which open or restricted tendering is not suitable because of the difficulty in defining precisely their services. The proposals shall be addressed to not less than 3 and not more than 7 candidates. The proposals contains terms of reference (description of services). Candidates for consultancy assignments must exclude themselves from subsequent procurement contracts. The procedure is as follows:</p>
<ol>
<li>Tender preparation and submission.</li>
<li>Opening is done in two phases (i) the technical proposals are opened first and (ii) later the financial proposal. The technical proposal determines who gets the contract.</li>
<li>Negotiations with candidates with respect to content</li>
<li>Award to the most advantageous proposal</li>
<li>Budget ceiling or man months for performance must be stipulated.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="specially-permitted-procurement">Specially Permitted Procurement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#specially-permitted-procurement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>This is used only when specially permitted by the Authority. It may include concessioning and design competition. This procedure is used</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Where exceptional requirements make it impossible, impracticable or uneconomical to comply with the Act and Regulations or</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>For specialized or requirements that are regulated or governed by harmonizing international standards or practices.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>This has been used in the agreement of Kenya Railways and Rift valley Railways</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="request-for-quotations">Request for Quotations<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#request-for-quotations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>This is another method of procurement commonly used where the procurement is of goods readily available and for which there is an established market; and the estimated value of goods being procured is less than or equal to the prescribed maximum value for using RFQ. The threshold for this is between Ksh. 500,000 to Ksh. 1,000,000 depending on the class of the procuring entity. The procedure is as follows:
Potential bidders are picked from the list of pre-qualified suppliers where this is mandatory or from known suppliers in the market or a list of approved suppliers from previous relationships. Depending on the size of the contract, 3-7 bidders are invited to compete for the business.</p>
<ol>
<li>A quotation committee or tender committee is convened</li>
<li>Quotation opening is done</li>
<li>Quotation Evaluation and adjudication</li>
<li>Contract award and notification to bidders</li>
<li>Signing of contract</li>
<li>Contract implementation</li>
</ol>
<p>Validity period of a quotation is 90 days</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="direct-procurement">Direct Procurement:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#direct-procurement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This method may only be used where only very rare goods are needed or only one candidate can supply the goods, services or works. There is no reasonable alternative or substitute for the goods, works or services; it can be used in times of national emergency and disaster. The circumstances that gave rise to the urgency are not foreseeable. It must not be used with a view to discriminate or avoid possible competition. Its threshold is Ksh. 300,000. The procedure is as follows</p>
<ol>
<li>Prepare need description</li>
<li>Describe special requirements as to quality, quantity, terms and times of delivery, price etc</li>
<li>Negotiation with sole candidate</li>
<li>Procurement agreement confirmed by signed contract</li>
<li>If below threshold Local Purchase Order/Local Service Order is issued</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="low-value-procurement">Low Value Procurement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#low-value-procurement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This method is used if</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>The estimated value of the goods, works or services being procured are less than or equal to the prescribed maximum value for this procedure</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>No benefit accrues to the PE in terms of time or costs if it uses this procedure</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The procedure is not being used to avoid competition</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The procedure has been recommended by the procurement committee after a market survey.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>This is cash purchase.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="request-for-proposals">Request for Proposals:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#request-for-proposals" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>This method is used to obtain consulting services or combinations of goods and service for which open or restricted tendering is not suitable because of the difficulty in defining precisely their services. The proposals shall be addressed to not less than 3 and not more than 7 candidates. The proposals contains terms of reference (description of services). Candidates for consultancy assignments must exclude themselves from subsequent procurement contracts. The procedure is as follows:</p>
<ol>
<li>Tender preparation and submission.</li>
<li>Opening is done in two phases (i) the technical proposals are opened first and (ii) later the financial proposal. The technical proposal determines who gets the contract.</li>
<li>Negotiations with candidates with respect to content</li>
<li>Award to the most advantageous proposal</li>
<li>Budget ceiling or man months for performance must be stipulated.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="specially-permitted-procurement">Specially Permitted Procurement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#specially-permitted-procurement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>This is used only when specially permitted by the Authority. It may include concessioning and design competition. This procedure is used</li>
<li>Where exceptional requirements make it impossible, impracticable or uneconomical to comply with the Act and Regulations or</li>
<li>For specialized or requirements that are regulated or governed by harmonizing international standards or practices.</li>
<li>This has been used in the agreement of Kenya Railways and Rift valley Railways</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-procurement-process">The Procurement Process<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-procurement-process" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>After the tendering process and a contract are signed, a Local Purchase Order or Local Service Order is raised for the goods or services as the case may be. The suppliers then supply the goods or carry out the service and submit a delivery note and an invoice. The goods are received in the stores after inspection and the delivery note signed by the store man and a copy left in the store. The invoice is attached with other transaction documents and taken to accounts department for payment. Procurement ends with the payment for the goods.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="stores-administration-and-control-including-warehousing">Stores administration and control (including warehousing)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stores-administration-and-control-including-warehousing" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This function is known by many names e.g. inventory management, stores management, materials management etc. It involves such activities:</p>
<ol>
<li>Receiving requisitions from the user departments</li>
<li>Inspection of goods</li>
<li>As receiving of goods into the storehouse</li>
<li>Storing the goods in the respective locations of the storehouse</li>
<li>Issuing of stores to users</li>
<li>Keeping records of receipts and issues</li>
<li>Maintaining acceptable stock levels</li>
<li>Ordering for more supplies in liaison with the procurement department</li>
<li>Ensure health and safety in stores</li>
<li>Identify items for disposal and arrange for the same.</li>
<li>Control of stocks</li>
<li>Coding and categorizing</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="the-common-documents-used-in-supply-management">The common documents used in supply management<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-common-documents-used-in-supply-management" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="local-purchase-order">Local Purchase Order:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#local-purchase-order" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>This is used to order goods from the supplier who was awarded as the need may arise.</li>
<li>It is an accountable document and once issued forms a valid contract.</li>
<li>It is issued by the procurement department in triplicate and approved by the accounting officer.</li>
<li>It has a column for the accounts officer to commit the funds in the vote book</li>
<li>The supplier signs as a sign of commitment and takes the original copies.</li>
<li>The duplicate is attached to the transaction documents i.e. Quotations, or tender.</li>
<li>The triplicate is attached to the payment voucher and the last copy left in the book for record purchase.</li>
<li>An LPO should never be issued before confirming availability of funds in the vote book.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="local-service-order">Local Service Order:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#local-service-order" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is used during purchase of services such as cleaning services, works as building etc.
The particulars are like those of an LPO and goes through the same process.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="counter-requisition-and-issue-voucher-s11">Counter Requisition and Issue Voucher: (S11)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#counter-requisition-and-issue-voucher-s11" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is used internally to make requisitions from the stores by user departments. The requisitioning officer should be the in charge of the department making the requisition. The receiving officer maybe anyone on behalf the requisitioning officer. It is filled in triplicate and requisitioning department keeps the duplicate, the original is filed away and the triplicate remains in the book as record.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="counter-receipt-voucher-s13">Counter Receipt Voucher (S13)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#counter-receipt-voucher-s13" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>When goods have been brought to the stores the S13 is used by the store man to acknowledge such receipt. A copy of this document must be attached</p>
<p>to the invoice when processing payment as evidence that the goods were bought and received in the store. It is filled in triplicate and procurement department keeps the original, the duplicate is attached to the invoice and the triplicate remains in the book as record.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="delivery-note">Delivery note<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#delivery-note" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>This accompanies the goods on delivery and lists the goods delivered stating their quantities. It is usually in duplicate. The store man signs it as acknowledgement of receipt. The suppliers take the duplicate and the original is retained in the store of the procuring Entity for record purposes.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-invoice">The Invoice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-invoice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is issued by the supplier on delivery of goods and is a demand for payment. It is attached with the triplicate copy of the LPO and a copy of the S13 and forwarded to accounts department for payment.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="consignment-note">Consignment note<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#consignment-note" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is used when goods are transported by a hired transporter. The sender of the goods is the consignor and the receiver is the consignee. The goods are the consignment. The contract here exists between the consignor and the transporter but the consignee has to ensure that the goods are as stipulated in the consignment note.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="packing-note">Packing Note:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#packing-note" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is usually inside a box containing goods or stack on the side showing the contents of the package. It is also referred to as a content note.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="stock-records">Stock records<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stock-records" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>These are documents that contain information about the stock held in the stores organization. The stock records maybe manual or electronic (computer).</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="functions-of-stock-records">Functions of Stock Records<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#functions-of-stock-records" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Stock records have very important functions to perform all of which are designed to provide information on which effective stores management and other operational decisions can be made.
These functions are:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>To supply information as to the calculated level of stock for each item</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>To supply information on verification of physical stock compared with the calculated figures in the stock records.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>To supply information for the formation of price lists and material costing methods.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>To supply information for financial control of the stock by virtue of the process of stock valuation.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>To supply information for the formulation of production plans and distribution plans both of which require detailed information about the levels of stock Minimum stock levels type, shelf life etc</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>To supply the clerical information on which the stock control system depends for effective operation.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>To supply information for the establishment and recording of stock levels for each item held in stock. The main stock levels are Minimum stock levels, maximum stock levels, Minimum stock levels re-order level;</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="stock-records-and-bin-card">Stock Records and Bin card<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stock-records-and-bin-card" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>The information generated by a stock records system is stored in a stock record card. It is designed to hold all information required. The scope and range of information stored on a stock card varies according to the needs of an organization. In the Government of Kenya the stock record is known as Stores Ledger and stock control card (S3).</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="bin-card">Bin Card<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#bin-card" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is the same as the S3 but has fewer columns. It is usually kept where the item of stock is and records receipts and issues and shows balances. In GOK today it is mostly used in the Hospital wards and drug Pharmacies.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sources-of-stock-record-information">Sources of Stock Record Information<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sources-of-stock-record-information" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>For any stock record system to operate effectively, it has to receive a continuous flow of source information about all the movement of and alterations to the stock held by the organization.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="stock-control">Stock Control<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stock-control" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Stock control is the total sum of principles and procedures necessary to maintain stocks at the appropriate levels in order to satisfy the authorized customer requirements at minimum costs. Stock control is the practices by which materials of the correct quantity and quality are made available when required with due regard to economy in storage and ordering costs, purchase prices and working capital. This involves:</p>
<ol>
<li>Regulating the receipt of stock items into the storehouse.</li>
<li>Regulating the issue of stock items into the storehouse.</li>
<li>Deciding the items to be held in stock; items to be held in stock are those which are frequently used and also those which may not be frequently used but are very important such that if they are out of stock the production of goods or services may have to halt.</li>
<li>Deciding the maximum value or quantity of stock which can be held at any one time in the warehouse.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="factors-influencing-levels-of-stock">Factors influencing levels of stock<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#factors-influencing-levels-of-stock" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Operational need</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Shelf life of the stock-if an item has a very restricted shelf life e.g. fruits and vegetables then the amount held will be short.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Delivery period- how long does it take from the time an order is placed to the time goods are received.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Buffer stock</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Capital available- the amount of capital that can be held in stocks without affecting other operations</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Storage capacity</p>
</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="constraints-of-stock-control">Constraints of stock control<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#constraints-of-stock-control" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>The aim of the stock control is to provide materials of the correct quantity and quality but there are constraints hindering the achievement of this objective. These constraints are:</p>
<ol>
<li>Finance</li>
<li>Storage facilities</li>
<li>Delays in supply</li>
<li>Security</li>
<li>Location</li>
<li>Distribution</li>
<li>Deterioration of stock</li>
<li>Personnel</li>
<li>Policy of an organization</li>
<li>Transport</li>
<li>Constraints of others</li>
<li>Other circumstances e.g. force majeure for instance earth quake, sunken road etc.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="stock-taking">Stock Taking<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stock-taking" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Stock taking is a simple term that means stock counting. It is the physical process of counting, checking, weighing and measuring all the materials, tools and other equipment held within the storehouse. The figures obtained from the physical count are then compared with the calculated levels of stock as indicated in the records system.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="reasons-for-stock-taking">Reasons for stock taking<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reasons-for-stock-taking" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>To verify the accuracy of stock recording control of stock by quantity, i.e. to ensure stock records agree with the physical stock.</li>
<li>To support the value shown in the balance sheet by physical verification.</li>
<li>To disclose the possibility of theft, fraud or loss.</li>
<li>To reveal any weakness in the system for the custody and control of stock.</li>
<li>To test the accuracy of computerized control systems.</li>
<li>To act as an indicator of overall stores efficiency and management control.</li>
<li>The number and size of stocktaking discrepancies are good indicators of efficiency.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="discrepancies">Discrepancies<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#discrepancies" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>A discrepancy is the difference between the calculated and the physical stock quantity. If the physical stock exceeds the calculated figure then there is a surplus or positive stock. If the physical stock is less than the calculated</p>
<p>figure then there is a deficiency or negative stock. The causes of discrepancies include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Incorrect stocks take.</li>
<li>Mathematical errors</li>
<li>Confused or changed units of issue</li>
<li>Misplacement of stocks into the wrong shelves, cupboard or other storage locations can result in stock being counted but recorded in the wrong stock count sheet.</li>
<li>The basic stores documents may be lost or entered incorrectly.</li>
<li>Stock taking adjustments from previous stock takes can influence the accuracy of the current stock take if the discrepancies were incorrectly written of as lost, only to become a surplus in the current stock take.</li>
<li>Stock taken from the stores without proper documentation or notification to the stores will result in the deficiencies.</li>
<li>Unreported damage or deterioration of stock</li>
<li>Theft or fraud of stock</li>
<li>Incorrect labeling of stock</li>
<li>Mistakes made in packing for issue or issue of wrong quantities.</li>
<li>Mislaid stock i.e. pushed off the rack or shelf.</li>
<li>Illegible handwriting or wrong copying of figures.</li>
</ul>
