<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="unit-7-health-information-systems">UNIT 7: HEALTH INFORMATION SYSTEMS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#unit-7-health-information-systems" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-1-the-sourcesof-health-information-systems">7.1. The sourcesof Health Information Systems<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-1-the-sourcesof-health-information-systems" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Census</li>
<li>Registration of Vital Events</li>
<li>Sample Registration System (SRS)</li>
<li>Notification of Diseases</li>
<li>Hospital Records</li>
<li>Disease Registers</li>
<li>Record Linkage</li>
<li>Epidemiological Surveillance</li>
<li>Other Health Service Records</li>
<li>Environmental Health Data</li>
<li>Health Manpower Statistics</li>
<li>Population Surveys</li>
<li>Other routine statistics related to health</li>
<li>Non-quantifiable information</li>
<li>Census refers to 'The total process of collecting, compiling and publishing demographic, economic and social data pertaining at a specified time or times, to ALL persons in a country or delimited territory'.
It is massive undertaking to contact every member of the population in a given time and collect a variety of information
The primary function of census was to collect demographic information i.e.</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>Total count of population</li>
<li>Break-up of the population into subgroups such as age and sex distribution</li>
<li>Census data provides a frame of reference and baseline information for administration, planning, action and research in medicine and social sciences</li>
<li>Population census provides the data used to compute health, demographic and socio economic indicators
Over the years, much more information is collected along with this</li>
<li>Social and economic characteristics of the households</li>
<li>Their living conditions e.g. type of fuel used, type of house etc.</li>
<li>Occupation</li>
<li>Income Etc.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-registration-of-vital-events">2. Registration of Vital Events<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-registration-of-vital-events" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Definition (UN): 'legal registration, statistical recording and reporting of the occurrence of and the collection, compilation, presentation, analysis and distribution of statistics pertaining to vital events'
Vital events include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Live births</li>
<li>Deaths</li>
<li>Fetal deaths</li>
<li>Marriage</li>
<li>Divorce</li>
<li>Adoptions</li>
<li>Legitimations</li>
<li>Recognitions</li>
<li>Annulments and</li>
<li>Legal separations</li>
</ul>
<p>The Vital event registration is unreliable. It lacks:</p>
<ul>
<li>Accuracy</li>
<li>Timeliness</li>
<li>Completeness and</li>
<li>Coverage</li>
<li>there is lack of uniformity in the collection</li>
<li>compilation and transmission of data, which is different for rural and urban areas and multiple registration agencies (e.g. health agency, panchayat agency, police agency and revenue agency)</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="3-sample-registration-system-srs">3. Sample Registration System (SRS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-sample-registration-system-srs" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>The civil registration system in Kenya has a lot to be improved and would require a huge effort and time. A need for having an alternate source of such information was felt.</p>
<p>SRS aims to provide reliable estimates of birth and death rates for the States and also at All Kenya level.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-following-features-of-srs-ensure-the-completeness-of-vital-events-reporting">The following features of SRS ensure the completeness of vital events reporting:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-following-features-of-srs-ensure-the-completeness-of-vital-events-reporting" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>A representative sample of the population is covered and NOT the WHOLE population</li>
<li>It is based on Dual - record system:</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>First a baseline survey of sampled units is done</li>
<li>This is followed by continuous enumeration of vital events of the areas by an enumerator (who is a volunteer from the community)</li>
<li>Independent retrospective 6-monthly surveys are done for recording births and deaths which occurred in the preceding 6 months and the number is matched with the one reported by the enumerator</li>
</ul>
<p>At present, the Sample Registration System (SRS) provides reliable annual data on fertility and mortality at the state and national levels for rural and urban areas separately. In this survey, the sample units, villages in rural areas and urban blocks in urban areas are replaced once in ten years</p>
<p>Various birth and death rates calculated in the world and State levels are based on SRS data only;</p>
<p>Birth rate, death rate, IMR, Total Fertility Rate, sex ratio at birth and in 0-4 yr age group, Child Mortality rate, institutional deliveries etc.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="4-notification-of-diseases">4. Notification of Diseases<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#4-notification-of-diseases" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Disease notification is a practice of reporting the occurrence of a specific disease or health-related condition to the appropriate and designated authority.</p>
<p>A notifiable disease is any disease that is required by law to be reported to government authorities.</p>
<p>Effective notification allows the authorities to monitor the disease, and provides early warning of possible outbreaks</p>
<p>A notifiable disease is one for which regular and timely information regarding individual cases is considered necessary for the prevention and control of the disease.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="reasons-for-declaring-a-disease-as-notifiable-may-be">Reasons for Declaring a Disease as Notifiable may be:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reasons-for-declaring-a-disease-as-notifiable-may-be" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>It is of interest to national or international regulations or control programs</li>
<li>Its National/ State/ District incidence</li>
<li>Its severity (potential for rapid mortality)</li>
<li>Its communicability/ Its potential to cause outbreaks</li>
<li>Significant risk of international spread</li>
<li>The socio-economic costs of its cases</li>
<li>Its preventability</li>
<li>Evidence that its pattern is changing</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="limitations-of-notification-system">Limitations of notification system:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#limitations-of-notification-system" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Notification data can include only a small portion of the total illness in the community</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The system suffers from a good deal of under reporting</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Atypical and subclinical cases escape notification e.g.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Rubella</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Non paralytic polio etc.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Accuracy of notification is dependent upon availability of facilities for diagnosis</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Often the disease is not reported because:</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Healthcare worker is not aware</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Intention to report a lower incidence to prove effective administration etc.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In spite of these limitations,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>notification provides valuable information about fluctuation in disease frequency</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>It also provides early warning about new occurrences or outbreaks of disease</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>It has become a valuable source of morbidity data i.e. the incidence and distribution of certain specified diseases which are notifiable.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Under IHR following diseases were notifiable to WHO:</p>
<ul>
<li>Cholera</li>
<li>Yellow fever and</li>
<li>Plague</li>
</ul>
<p>In 2005 revision, following diseases were added:</p>
<ul>
<li>smallpox,</li>
<li>poliomyelitis due to wild-type poliovirus,</li>
<li>SARS and</li>
<li>cases of human influenza caused by a new subtype</li>
</ul>
<p>Diseases under International surveillance are</p>
<ul>
<li>Louse borne typhus</li>
<li>Relapsing fever</li>
<li>Polio</li>
<li>Influenza</li>
<li>Malaria</li>
<li>Rabies and</li>
<li>Salmonellosis</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="now-some-non-communicable-diseases-are-in-the-ambit-of-notification-e-g">Now some non-communicable diseases are in the ambit of notification e.g<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#now-some-non-communicable-diseases-are-in-the-ambit-of-notification-e-g" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Cancer</li>
<li>Congenital malformations</li>
<li>Mental illness</li>
<li>Stroke and</li>
<li>Handicapped persons</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="hospital-records">Hospital Records<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#hospital-records" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>These are the documents that relate to a patient while they have been in.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="limitations">Limitations:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#limitations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>The cases constitute only the tip of the iceberg - i.e. they provide information on only those patients who seek medical care but not on a representative sample of the population. Mild cases may not attend hospitals; subclinical cases are always missed</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The admission policy may vary from hospital to hospital; therefore hospital statistics tend to be highly selective</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Population served by a hospital cannot be defined. Hence there is no the denominator. hospital statistics are a poor guide to the estimation of disease frequency in a community</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="a-study-of-hospital-data-provides-information-on-the-following-aspects">A study of hospital data provides information on the following aspects:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-study-of-hospital-data-provides-information-on-the-following-aspects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Geographic sources of patients</li>
<li>Age and sex distribution of different diseases and duration of hospital stay</li>
<li>Distribution of diagnosis</li>
<li>Association of between different diseases</li>
<li>The period between disease and hospital admission</li>
<li>The distribution of patients according to different social can biological characteristics and</li>
<li>The cost of hospital care</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="hospital-information-is-useful-in-planning-of-health-services-indices-needed-for-this-purpose-are">Hospital information is useful in planning of health services. Indices needed for this purpose are:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#hospital-information-is-useful-in-planning-of-health-services-indices-needed-for-this-purpose-are" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Bed occupancy rates</li>
<li>Duration of stay</li>
<li>Cost effectiveness of treatment policies is useful in monitoring the use of hospital facilities</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="7-disease-registers">7. Disease Registers<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-disease-registers" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>A registry is basically a list of all the patients in the defined population who have a particular condition.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>It is different from 'notification' where the case is reported and is counted once.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A register requires that a permanent record be established</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>that the cases be followed up and</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>that basis statistical tabulation be prepared both on frequency and on survival</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Hence mostly for chronic conditions</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In addition the patients on a register are frequently be the subjects of special studies</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>It helps keep track of</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>when they were seen last,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>what tests and treatments they have had and</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Survival etc.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Morbidity registers are a valuable source of information such as the</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>duration of illness, case fatality and survival</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Natural history of disease especially chronic diseases</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="limitations">Limitations:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#limitations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Absence of a defined population base, hence incidence and prevalence rates can't be calculated</li>
<li>Population based registry can provide this if complete reporting can be ensured</li>
<li>Morbidity registers exist only for certain diseases and conditions such as stroke, myocardial infarction, cancer, blindness, congenital defects and congenital rubella etc.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-2-types-and-systems-of-health-information">7.2. Types and systems of health information<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-2-types-and-systems-of-health-information" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="there-are-two-types-of-registries">There are two types of registries:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#there-are-two-types-of-registries" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="1-hospital-based">1. Hospital based<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-hospital-based" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>It involves recording of information on the patients seen in a particular hospital. The primary purpose of hospital based registries is to contribute to patient care by providing readily accessible information on the patients, the treatment received and its results. The data is also used for clinical research and for epidemiological purposes.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-objectives-of-hospital-based-registry">The objectives of hospital based registry:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-objectives-of-hospital-based-registry" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Assess patient care</li>
<li>Participate in clinical research to evaluate therapy</li>
<li>Provide an idea of the patterns of cases</li>
<li>Contribute to follow up of the patients</li>
<li>Epidemiological research through case control studies</li>
<li>Show time trends in the stage of diagnosis</li>
<li>Help study the quality of care for the patients in the hospitals</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-population-based-registry">2. Population-Based Registry:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-population-based-registry" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>A population-based disease registry contains and tracks records for people diagnosed with a specific type of disease who reside within a defined geographic region (i.e., a community, city, or state-wide)</p>
<p>The major concern of Population Based Registries is to calculate the incidence rates.</p>
<p>Population Based Registry systematically collects information on all reportable cases occurring in a geographically defined population from multiple sources.</p>
<ul>
<li>The comparison and interpretation of population based incidence data support population-based actions aimed at reducing the burden in the community.</li>
<li>The systematic ascertainment of incidence from multiple sources can provide an unbiased profile of the burden in the population and how it is changing over time.</li>
<li>These registries can provide data for planning and evaluating control programmes.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="1-record-linkage">1. Record Linkage<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-record-linkage" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Record linkage means bringing together information that relates to the same individual or family, from different data sources. In this way it is possible to construct chronological sequences of health events for individuals</li>
<li>The records may originate in different time or places.</li>
<li>Medical record linkage implies the gathering and maintenance of one file for each individual in a population, with records relating to his/her health.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-events-commonly-recorded-are">The events commonly recorded are<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-events-commonly-recorded-are" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>birth, marriage, death,</li>
<li>hospital admission and discharge</li>
<li>sickness absence from work,</li>
<li>prophylactic procedures</li>
<li>use of social services, etc.</li>
</ul>
<p>Record linkage is a particularly suitable method of studying association between diseases; these associations may have etiological significance.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-challenges-with-record-linkage-are">The challenges with record linkage are<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-challenges-with-record-linkage-are" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>the volume of data that can accumulate</li>
<li>Need for technology</li>
<li>Privacy issues</li>
<li>Involvement of different agencies for different records</li>
<li>High chances of incomplete retrieval of information</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-epidemiological-surveillance">2. Epidemiological Surveillance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-epidemiological-surveillance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Surveillance systems are set up for select diseases under the respective control/eradication program as a procedural matter</p>
<p>The purpose of this surveillance is to keep an eye on the incidence, prevalence and changing pattern of the particular disease so as to adjust the control measures accordingly.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<ul>
<li>AFP surveillance data under polio eradication</li>
<li>Leprosy cases surveillance under NLEP</li>
<li>No. of children give JE vaccine etc.</li>
</ul>
<p>These programs have yielded considerable morbidity and mortality data foe the specific diseases.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="3-other-health-service-records">3. Other Health Service Records<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-other-health-service-records" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Apart from hospitals, records are also maintained in:</p>
<ul>
<li>Primary health centers</li>
<li>Polyclinics</li>
<li>MCH centers</li>
<li>School health records</li>
<li>Special clinics like diabetic clinic, autism clinic, cardiac clinics</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="4-environmental-health-data">4. Environmental Health Data<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#4-environmental-health-data" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Sometimes information on environment may be needed for studying its effects on health</p>
<p>Data is then required on various aspects of</p>
<ul>
<li>air, water and noise pollution;</li>
<li>harmful food additives;</li>
<li>industrial toxicants,</li>
<li>inadequate waste disposal and other aspects</li>
</ul>
<p>Collection of environmental data remains a major problem for future research</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="5-manpower-statistics">5. Manpower Statistics<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-manpower-statistics" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>For planning, administration and evaluation of health services, information on health manpower is important.</p>
<p>Such information includes the number of</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>physicians (by age, sex, specialty and place of work),</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>dentists (classified in the same way),</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>pharmacists,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>veterinarian,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>hospital nurses,</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>medical technicians, etc.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Their records are maintained by the State medical/dental/nursing councils and the Directorates of Medical Education.</p>
<p>The census also provides information about occupation.
The Institute of Applied Manpower Research attempts estimates of manpower, taking into account different sources of data, mortality and outturn of qualified persons from the different institutions.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="6-population-surveys">6. Population Surveys<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#6-population-surveys" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>The health information from the sources discussed before do not provide information for all the diseases prevalent in and the health status of the community</p>
<p>The statistics regarding diseases prevalent in the community and the health status of the community are of importance for public health administration. Also for research in any one disease or health related state one may not find the required information in these records.</p>
<p>This calls for conduct of population surveys for the specific health problem/s
The term 'health survey' is used for surveys for studying any aspect of health - morbidity, mortality, nutritional status etc.</p>
<p>Survey for studying the diseases in a community is known as 'morbidity survey'</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="health-surveys-are-of-the-following-types">Health surveys are of the following types<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#health-surveys-are-of-the-following-types" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Survey for studying the diseases prevalent and their distribution in the population and the health status of the individuals</li>
<li>This is needed for planning and developing the health services for this population</li>
<li>Surveys for studying factors affecting health or 'risk factors'</li>
<li>Surveys for assessing administration of health services e.g. utilization rates, out-of-pocket expenditure on health, unmet health needs etc.</li>
</ol>
<p>Sampling techniques are available so that estimates at any level of precision desired can be achieved. Hence the precision level may be set in accordance with the constraints of available resources and the appropriate sample size may be surveyed.</p>
<p>Health surveys may be</p>
<ul>
<li>cross sectional or longitudinal</li>
<li>Descriptive or analytical (or both)</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="data-collection-in-surveys-can-be-carried-out-in-one-or-more-of-the-following-methods">Data collection in surveys can be carried out in one or more of the following methods:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#data-collection-in-surveys-can-be-carried-out-in-one-or-more-of-the-following-methods" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Health examination</li>
<li>Health (face to face) interview</li>
<li>Health records</li>
<li>Mailed questionnaire</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="each-method-has-its-own-advantages-and-disadvantages-and-may-be-suitable-in-varying-situations">Each method has its own advantages and disadvantages and may be suitable in varying situations.<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#each-method-has-its-own-advantages-and-disadvantages-and-may-be-suitable-in-varying-situations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ol>
<li>Health examination of the members is suitable when morbidity survey is carried out</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>The survey team includes doctors, technicians, interviewers etc.</li>
<li>Hence it is expensive and not suitable for an extensive scale</li>
<li>It carries the issue of providing treatment to those found ill.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-the-health-interview-face-to-face-survey-is-a-suitable-for-assessing-subjective-phenomena-such-as">2. The health interview (face to face) survey is a suitable for assessing subjective phenomena such as<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-the-health-interview-face-to-face-survey-is-a-suitable-for-assessing-subjective-phenomena-such-as" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Perceived morbidity, disability and impairment;</li>
<li>Economic loss due to illness,</li>
<li>Expenditure incurred on medical care;</li>
<li>Opinions, beliefs and attitudes;</li>
<li>Some behavioral characteristics etc.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="3-health-records-survey-involves-collection-of-data-from-health-service-records">3. Health records survey involves collection of data from health service records.<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-health-records-survey-involves-collection-of-data-from-health-service-records" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This is evidently the cheapest method of collecting data. This method has several disadvantages:</p>
<ul>
<li>The estimates obtained from the records are not population based</li>
<li>Reliability of data is open to question, and</li>
<li>Lack of uniform procedures and standardization in recording of data.</li>
</ul>
<ol start="4">
<li>The use of questionnaire is simpler and cheaper and they may be sent, for example, by mail to persons sampled from a given target population.
A certain level of education and skill is ex<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>â‹…</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\cdot</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4445em;"></span><span class="mord">â‹…</span></span></span></span></span> Sources of data other than health are also required by the epidemiologists to study health, disease, risk factors etc.
The following list, which is not comprehensive, merely serves to give examples of such sources of data expected from the respondents</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>There is usually a high rate of non-response.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="14-other-routine-statistics-related-to-health">14. Other routine statistics related to health<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#14-other-routine-statistics-related-to-health" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Demographic: In addition to routine census data, statistics on such other demographic phenomena as population density, movement and educational level</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Economic: consumption of tobacco, dietary fats and domestic coal; sales of drugs and remedies; information concerning per capita income; employment and unemployment data.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Social security schemes: medical insurance schemes make it possible to study the occurrence of illnesses in the insured population.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Other data that may be needed comprise sickness absence, sickness and disability benefit rates.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="15-non-quantifiable-information">15. Non-quantifiable information<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#15-non-quantifiable-information" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Health planners and decision makers require a lot of non-quantifiable information too e.g.</li>
<li>Information on health policies,</li>
<li>Health legislation,</li>
<li>Public attitudes,</li>
<li>Program procedures and technology.</li>
</ul>
<p>In other words, a health information system has multi-disciplinary inputs.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-2-types-and-systems-of-health-information">7.2 Types and Systems of Health Information<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-2-types-and-systems-of-health-information" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Healthcare information systems capture, store, manage, or transmit information related to the health of individuals or the activities of an organization that work within the health sector.
There are many different types of healthcare information systems, including:</p>
<ul>
<li>Operational and tactical systems for easy classification of information.</li>
<li>Clinical and administrative systems for managing patient details on an administrative level.</li>
<li>Subject and task based systems such as Electronic Medical Records (EMRs) or Electronic Health Records (EHRs).</li>
<li>Financial systems for tracking revenue and managing billing submissions.</li>
<li>These systems are designed to assist healthcare providers with managing daily tasks and patient information. Often, these types of systems are broken up into different software solutions, butwhat if you could have all of these systems packaged into one convenient software solution?</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="7-3-the-use-of-health-information-and-decision-making-in-health-care-delivery">7.3. The use of health information and decision making in health care delivery<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#7-3-the-use-of-health-information-and-decision-making-in-health-care-delivery" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-use-of-health-information-and-decision-making-in-health-care-delivery">The Use of Health Information and Decision Making in Health Care Delivery<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-use-of-health-information-and-decision-making-in-health-care-delivery" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Health information systems strongly influence quality and efficiency of health care, and technical progress offers advanced opportunities to support health care.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-significance-of-information-systems-for-health-care">The Significance of Information systems for Health Care<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-significance-of-information-systems-for-health-care" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>For example: when a patient is admitted to a hospital, a physician or nurse first needs information about the reason for patient admission and about the patient history. Later, she or he needs results from services such as laboratory and radiology which are some of the most frequent diagnostic procedures</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information processing is an important quality factor, but an enormous cost factor as well. It is also becoming a productivity factor.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Communication is increasingly supported by electronic means</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Computer-based training systems strongly support efficient learning for health care professionals</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Information and communication technology (ICT) has become economically important and decisive for the quality of health care. It will continue to change health care</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Impact on quality of care</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Impact on economics</p>
</li>
